Title: Lemon loaf
Author: Felicity
Intro: This is a fantastically zingy loaf that works a treat for morning or afternoon tea. Yum!
Body:
I think that it is essential to have a good loaf recipe in your back pocket.
You know those times when people decide to drop round last minute - this is perfect for that.
The smell of lemon permeates the air in the most lovely way. Combine that with the smell of baked goods and you're onto a winner of a welcomer.
This can be easily taken to the next level with the addition of some fresh thyme leaves - 2 Tbsp chopped into the batter, and 3 sprigs added to the syrup.
Method: Preheat oven to 170˚C Bake. Line a loaf tin and set aside
Cream the butter, 190g sugar and zest of 2 lemons
Add the eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition for 20 seconds or so
Add the flour and salt. Mix lightly
Add the sour cream and mix to combine ensuring everything is well combined
Pour into the loaf tin and bake for 20 minutes
While the loaf bakes, make the syrup by combining the remaining sugar (40g), zest of 1 lemon, and the water in a small saucepan
Bring to a boil then cook so it reduces by half
Pour over the warm loaves and serve

Comments.Comment: Tasty recipe. Could use even more lemon in my opinion
